overview: Thisresearchsubject provides graduate students in music psychology with the knowledge and skills needed to devise and conduct research at the graduate level.

This is achieved through a series of lectures, seminars, group discussions and peer review sessions that engage students with intellectual and methodological perspectives within the field of music psychology, including approaches related to perception and cognition, social and applied psychology, developmental psychology, performance science, and performance pedagogy.

A particular emphasis is given to ethical considerations for undertaking research in music psychology, and the processes of generating research questions, designing research studies, and collecting, analysing and interpreting research data.

assessments.description: Five written assignments spanning research methodology and design, theory, data analysis and/or research ethics.. 5000 words (total)
Engagement consisting of participation in peer assessment activities and contribution to either class or online discussions.

Semester 1 - Online.Contact hours: 24 hours of online lectures, 10 hours of tutorials.

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
